description.plain:
Radric Davis, popularly known as Gucci Mane, is an Atlanta rapper who has released over one hundred full-length projects. Gucci’s impressive discography is comprised of 15 studio albums, seven EPs, a handful of collaborative albums, and over six-dozen mixtapes.

Gucci is recognized by many as one of the founders of the trap sub-genre and is cited by many modern rappers as one of their greatest influences. Under his self-owned label, 1017 BrickSquad, Guwop has signed artists like Young Thug, Waka Flocka Flame, and Chief Keef. Here’s a more complete infographic of his impact on the genre.

Although Mr. Davis has achieved many milestones in his career, his 20-years as a Trap God has been plagued with legal issues and drug addiction, and the star has faced a slew of charges including assaults, drug charges, and even murder. Fortunately, after serving over two years in an Indiana federal prison, Gucci seems to have turned things around. When he was released in 2016, Gucci was quick to show the world his weight loss and sobriety, which shocked many into thinking he was a clone.

Since his turn-around, Gucci has earned a #1 Billboard hit, written a New York Time’s bestselling book, The Autobiography of Gucci Mane, and married his longtime supermodel girlfriend Keyshia Ka'oir in a lavish 1.7 million dollar wedding.

songs.full_title: I Get the Bag by Gucci Mane (Ft. Migos)
songs.title: I Get the Bag

description.plain:
“I Get the Bag” is a promotional single from Gucci Mane’s thirteenth studio album, Mr. Davis, where he teams up with an Offset-less Migos.

Takeoff and Quavo rap about their drug-fueled ways and Gucci brags about his wealth and his women. Gucci previously collaborated with Migos on their single, “Slippery” which shares similar flows on this song.

songs.full_title: Both by Gucci Mane (Ft. Drake)
songs.title: Both

description.plain:
On “Both,” Gucci and Drake collaborate for the second time in 2016. The first being “Back on Road” released days after Gucci’s release from prison.

In the song, Gucci and Drake speak on multiple topics including Lil Yachty, luxury lifestyles, and stuff Drizzy doesn’t usually do: making reckless decisions from drinking and smoking.

The song debuted at No. 41 on the Billboard Hot 100, establishing a record on Drake’s career, earning his 132nd Hot 100 hit—tying Lil Wayne’s record for the most Hot 100 appearances by a solo artist.

description.plain:
“Curve” was officially released on September 13, 2017. It will serve as track 5 on Gucci Mane’s upcoming LP Mr. Davis.



The Weeknd has been teasing this collaboration for a couple weeks leading up to his Phase 2 Starboy Tour, where Gucci Mane is an opener.

NAV has confirmed he produced the song on Instagram. It is also co-produced by FrostADX.

songs.full_title: Truth by Gucci Mane
songs.title: Truth

description.plain:
“Truth” is a critically acclaimed (non) diss track from Gucci stemming from his years-long feud with fellow Atlanta rapper Jeezy.

The beef began when the two collaborated on Gucci’s 2005 track “So Icy,” which both rappers claim as their own song.

Later that year the beef took a deadly turn when Jeezy put a $10,000 bounty on Gucci’s ice cream cone chain in his song “Stay Strapped:”

Matter of fact, real talk nigga, I got a bounty on that shit nigga, ten stacks…to snatch that motherfucker off his neck

Five armed men, in an attempt to snatch the chain, broke into a home Gucci Mane was in. After a brief struggle, Gucci shot and killed one of the assailants, Pookie Loc, a rapper signed to Jeezy’s label. Weeks later, after the body was discovered buried by a middle school, Gucci Mane was charged with murder. This incident inspired these infamous bars from “Truth:”

Go dig your partner up, nigga, bet he can’t say shit
And if you looking for the kid, I’ll be in Zone 6

songs.full_title: Last Time by Gucci Mane (Ft. Travis Scott)
songs.title: Last Time

description.plain:
On “Last Time,” Gucci addresses his past as a drug user and sets the record straight regarding the clone rumors that were circulated after he was released from prison while Travis discusses drugs and his lavish lifestyle.

This new collaboration was teased in a now-deleted Instagram video posted by ILLROOTS.

Gucci and Travis performed the single together on Jimmy Kimmel Live. However, the YouTube video of their performance is now private and cannot be viewed unless permission is granted to the user.

songs.full_title: 1st Day out Tha Feds by Gucci Mane
songs.title: 1st Day out Tha Feds

description.plain:
This is the first song Gucci Mane dropped the day after after being released from jail on May 26th, 2016. It’s a nod to his 2009 song, “First Day Out.” According to Forbes, the song was streamed 1.1 million times in the first 24 hours of release, 900,000 of those in the first 12 hours.

On September 13th, 2013, Gucci was arrested for a concealed weapon, possession of marijuana , and disorderly conduct. After serving a 183 days in jail, Gucci was released, only to be caught with a firearm. He pleaded guilty, and agreed to a plea deal which resulted in his prison stay until late 2016, for possession of a firearm by a felon.

He was subsequently released from prison four months early, causing social media to explode with the anticipation of new music. Gucci wasted no time and dropped “First Day Out Tha Feds” on Soundcloud the next day.

https://twitter.com/gucci1017/status/736168044871962624

The music video dropped on July 5, 2016 via World Star Hip Hop:

http://www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/video.php?v=wshh27Fcf6vY0X27eK74

songs.full_title: Drove U Crazy by Gucci Mane (Ft. Bryson Tiller)
songs.title: Drove U Crazy

description.plain:
“Drove U Crazy” is a smooth fusion of Gucci’s Trap and Tiller’s R&B. Their first collab boasts daily activities of the rich and famous, street credibility, and the burdens of past relationships.

The track debuted on Travis’s Scott’s .wav Radio ft. Yung Lean & Gucci on Apple Music.

songs.full_title: Rumors by Gucci Mane (Ft. Lil Durk)
songs.title: Rumors

description.plain:
On “Rumors,” Gucci Mane reunites with Lil Durk on an energetic track that sees Durk dismissing any rumors or lies that have been spread about him and Gucci calling out pretenders.

The official music video for the song premiered on January 25, 2022. Gucci announced the song and video the day before. He and Durk were spotted filming the video with fellow rapper EST Gee and Durk’s Only the Family signees, Doodie Lo, Booka600, and Memo600, on January 14, 2022.

songs.full_title: Both (Remix) by Gucci Mane (Ft. Drake & Lil Wayne)
songs.title: Both (Remix)

description.plain:
After reuniting with Nicki Minaj on “No Frauds” and “Changed It,” Lil Wayne and Drake link up again on the remix to “Both”.

With Wayne leading things off with a new verse, the YM boss raps about being “high” while referencing percs, pills, and whippin'  yayo in the process.

The hit “Both” first dropped in December 2016, serves as the third track off Gucci’s studio tenth album East Atlanta Santa.

The track comes a little over a week after Gucci released his “Drop Top Wizop Freestyle” which is also the name of his upcoming 11th studio album Drop Top Wizop.

songs.full_title: Wasted by Gucci Mane (Ft. Plies)
songs.title: Wasted

description.plain:
One of Gucci Mane’s most iconic pre-prison songs, “Wasted” is a drugged-out dirty south party anthem with an emphasis on getting as intoxicated as possible. While not Guwop’s first hit, “Wasted” was a major mainstream breakthrough for the trap legend, peaking at #36 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, his highest-charting single as the lead artist until 2017’s “I Get the Bag.”

In his 2017 autobiography The Autobiography of Gucci Mane, the rapper describes how well the song caught on with audiences:

…I was performing at a club in Jacksonville, North Carolina, when the crowd started chanting for “Wasted.”
“Wasted, Wasted, Wasted!”
I didn’t even remember the lyrics to “Wasted.” … But Holiday had it on his laptop and when he played it the crowd went fucking crazy."

“Wasted” became the lead single for Gucci’s successful 2009 album The State Vs. Radric Davis and is considered one of the rapper’s signature songs. A music video for the track was released on October 5, 2009, with fellow rapper Plies and cameos from Jim Jones, Snoop Dogg, and Gucci’s then-protege Waka Flocka Flame, among others.

body.plain:
One of Gucci Mane’s most iconic pre-prison songs, “Wasted” is a drugged-out dirty south party anthem with an emphasis on getting as intoxicated as possible. While not Guwop’s first hit, “Wasted” was a major mainstream breakthrough for the trap legend, peaking at #36 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, his highest-charting single as the lead artist until 2017’s “I Get the Bag.”

In his 2017 autobiography The Autobiography of Gucci Mane, the rapper describes how well the song caught on with audiences:

…I was performing at a club in Jacksonville, North Carolina, when the crowd started chanting for “Wasted.”
“Wasted, Wasted, Wasted!”
I didn’t even remember the lyrics to “Wasted.” … But Holiday had it on his laptop and when he played it the crowd went fucking crazy."

“Wasted” became the lead single for Gucci’s successful 2009 album The State Vs. Radric Davis and is considered one of the rapper’s signature songs. A music video for the track was released on October 5, 2009, with fellow rapper Plies and cameos from Jim Jones, Snoop Dogg, and Gucci’s then-protege Waka Flocka Flame, among others.
